body:
Jump to

  • What is an ad flight?
  • How do I set up an ad flight?
  • Can I add more than one ad flight?
  • How do I edit an ad flight?
  • How do I delete or complete an ad flight?

What is an ad flight?

A flight is just the advertising term for your campaign’s schedule. When you schedule an ad flight, you’re specifying when you want your ads to serve. You set up your first one up when you launch your campaign.

In the example above, the flight scheduled is to start immediately and continue serving your ads indefinitely until you add an end date.

For most, one AdGroup and schedule is all they need, and in this case the schedule you set on the campaign level is all you need.

Flighting your ad group

It may make sense to consider an ad flight if both of these are true:

  • You have more than one AdGroup in your campaign
  • You have a set of ads you want to serve over a specific date range

How do I set up an ad flight?

1. In “Campaigns”, click on the campaign’s name, and then the AdGroup’s name. This brings you to the AdGroup-level in your campaign.

2. In the right sidebar, click "Edit AdGroup."

3. Click “Set Custom Schedule”.

4. Set your ad flight dates: Similar to your campaign schedule, dates will default to “Immediately” and “No end date”. If you have a future start date or a definite end date in mind, click on the corresponding field to select your date range.

5. (Optional) Customize a start and end time.

6. Make sure you save your changes by clicking “Done” and then “Update Campaign”.

An example ad flight

In the example below, we set up our Holiday Special AdGroup to begin serving November 1 starting 12:00AM UTC and ending December 25 at 12:00PM UTC.

Can I add more than one ad flight?

Yes. You can add additional flights it in the “Edit Campaign” or “Edit AdGroup” page.

1. Either “Edit Campaign" or “Edit AdGroup.”

2. Hover your mouse over the scheduled flight. When the pencil icon appears, click to edit.

3. Click the + button to add an additional flight.

4. Specify your start and end dates (like when you set up your first flight).
Make sure you save through to "Update Campaign.”

How do I edit an ad flight?

Inactive flights

If your scheduled flight has not yet started, you can edit it in the “Edit Campaign” or “Edit AdGroup” page.

1. Either “Edit Campaign” or “Edit AdGroup.”

2. Hover your mouse over the scheduled flight. When the pencil icon appears, click edit.

3. Click on the start date or end date (or time) to edit it.

4. Make sure you save through to “Update Campaign.”

Active flights

If your scheduled flight has already started, you can only make changes to your end date. Follow the same steps above to edit your flight.

How do I delete or complete an ad flight?

Inactive flights

Inactive flights can be deleted in the “Edit Campaign” or “Edit AdGroup” page.

1. Either “Edit Campaign” or “Edit AdGroup.”

2. Hover your mouse over the scheduled flight. When the pencil icon appears, click to edit.


3. Click the X button to delete.


4. Make sure you save through to “Update Campaign.”

Active flights

If your ad flight has already started, following the directions above completes your flight. For your reference, we will document the total run time of your ad flight as a completed ad flight.
name: Scheduling Ad Flights
title: Scheduling Ad Flights
